blog.description: we are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. that is our great glory, and our great tragedy.

summary: Y’all the look on Sansa’s face when she sees Jon running across the battlefield with Tormund and their friendly giant to go...
body:
Y’all the look on Sansa’s face when she sees Jon running across the battlefield with Tormund and their friendly giant to go after Ramsay, both for his home and so Ramsay will never touch Sansa again just broke me. What has this rewatch done.

Seems like a look of pride at their accomplishments of beating Ramsay and a look of fear at knowing who Ramsay is and what Jon is running towards.

I never even considered the ship until two days ago. Until then I’ve been a Jonerys supporter. And now I’m both! Each for their own reasons, with explicitly different interpretations of key scenes. Let’s not forget we, as humans, are not single faceted cardboard boxes.

Also, just a reminder for the future and anybody who comes across this. Even if you’re anti one or the other, scrolling by is truly possible, I promise. Especially on the front of interpretation.

(edited)

summary: So I recently watched some videos/theories regarding Daenerys vision in the house of undying, especially the part where she...
body:
House of Undying theory:

So I recently watched some videos/theories regarding Daenerys vision in the house of undying, especially the part where she nearly touches the throne.

A lot of people seem to think this foreshadows her death, because instead of grabbing the throne she walks towards her dead husband Khal Drogo and finds herself beyond the wall.

And this is a hint for her dying, isn’t it?

Well, I have to disagree.

I agree, that it was never Daenerys destiny to rule or reclaim the iron throne, she therefore didn’t touch it (also: you weren’t made to sit on the iron throne. You are a conquer Daenerys Stormborn)

But this does not mean she will die. She didn’t touch the throne because in the vision, she heard her babies (her dragons) scream. In the vision she has to decide if she touches the throne (become queen) or if she saves her children (her family), and she choses her family.

For me this scene is so important because I don‘t believe she wants the iron throne. She wants a place she can call her home and a family. She never had that. She THINKS by conquering the iron throne she will get both, but that’s wrong. In the show she thought Dragon Stone was her home because she was born there but she later says „it doesn’t feel like home“. Dany won‘t feel home in Kings Landing either.

Now my theory: I believe (as do many other people) that Dany and Jon will have a baby. This baby and Jon represent the dragons screaming in her vision. She has to decide if she will still concentrate on getting the iron throne or if she will start a family with Jon and her baby. The baby might even be the reason for her finaly realizing that she wants to have a family. If she finds out Jon is s Targaryen and has a better claim than her she won’t be happy about this. But because of the baby she will realize that she actually doesn’t care about this iron throne.

The second thing I want to discuss is the Khal Drogo scene. Many people think this means she will die beyond the wall.

But for me this part of the prophecy already came true:

Dany traveled beyond the wall.

There Viserion (her dragon) died (Viserion represents her baby she saw together with Khal Drogo) and she had to leave Jon (her love) behind (exactly like she left Khal Drogo in her vision).

If Dany had stayed with Khal Drogo this might have been a clue for her death, because he represents the death in her vision. But she didn’t. She left him.

So what do you think?

title: BREAD CRUMBS OF A BETRAYAL........
body:
Tyrion Lannister explaining to the audience how smart he is. A few season later, he will be blindised by Shae’s betrayal. He took Shae to Kings Landing and made her his mistress believing her to be harmless. He never thought she could sell him in the trial or have an affair with his own father….. oops.


Tyrion Lannister explaining to Daenerys why she should invite Jon Snow to Dragonstone. He STILL believes he is a great judge of character. Some characters in this story will never learn with their mistakes…..

blog.name: princess-who-was-promised
blog.title: darkargo
blog.description: Game of Thrones, Star Wars, DC                        Comics, Thirty Seconds to Mars, Demi.                               Lovato, and art.      Just a few things I enjoy.

body:
I have a predicament…

It’s now 2019. Cool. HOWEVER MANY THINGS HAPPEN THIS YEAR THAT MARK THE END.

For example:

- The Avengers (April 2019)

- Game of Thrones (April 2019)

- Star Wars “The Skywalker Saga” (December 2019)


All I’m saying is that Ben Solo needs to get his shit together, Dany needs to survive the Great War (with or without Jon (with Jon would be pretty nice though)), and I don’t even know what to say about the Avengers. But everyone is dying, people are dying everywhere.

summary: This year is the year of the fandom! Even though it's gonna be sad af seeing jonerys and Reylo for the last time 😞😢. At least we...
body:
HAPPY NEW YEAR! TO ALL MY FOLLOWERS, FRIENDS AND MUTRALS 💖💖💖💖.

This year is the year of the fandom! Even though it’s gonna be sad af seeing jonerys and Reylo for the last time 😞😢. At least we r gonna get some new content aka new edit, fan art, A03 inspiration to last us years in advance and tbh? I couldn’t be happier!

Thank you sooooo much to @oadara @ellimomo @ktwrites . You three have been my ride or die since the start! Lmao (back when my blog was an absolute mess!) You all brought me into the jonerys community with open arms + humored me like no other 💖💖 thank u for the continued support + I can’t wait to finish this jonerys journey with u this year…gonna be sad af. But I’m glad we r all here to celebrate it 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾

@zae82 I was honestly a fangirl of u ever since u started publishing your jonerys fan fics (which are award winning btw 😂) I love your passion for all period drama and the British culture (cause I’m British) + u continue to be full of kindness and joy I’m so blessed to have gotten to known u this year 😁.

Now…my anti (u know who) army. Fighting against injustice against towards jonerys + doing with such finesse it’s golden 😂 @dragons-daughter-blog @akurotori @daenerys1417 . I have to laugh. Because whenever I see some bullshit on my tag or on twitter whenever I post it here you guys are always the first to spill some tea and break names 😂👏🏾 I can not WAIT for the sweet taste of Jonerys endgame and I want yall all with me lmao.

If I forgot some names I’m so sorry! I’m half still buzzed from last night so I dunno what I’m doing anymore 😂😂😂.

But to ALL THE FANDOM PEOPLE HAPPY NEW YEAR! 🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉🎉 hope it’s an amazing one + we all have health and positivity.

(my video btw 😏😂)

summary: Just Rewatched The Winds of Winter
body:
Just Rewatched The Winds of Winter

on HBO2. Jon and Daenerys better win that ugly goddamn throne. It’s probably what the most people want but who cares. They’ve earned it. Team Targ forever. Fire and Blood bitch.

blog.name: chitowngirl-12
blog.title: Chicago Diva
blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

tags: Power couple means that both people have power
Jon is not politically valuable to Dany as an alliance
The consequence of making Dany overpowered is that all other characters are diminished and unimportant
Daario and Daenerys are apparently a power couple according to the show
summary: Weird Idea about what a Power Couple is in Season 8 GOT Stories
title: Weird Idea about what a Power Couple is in Season 8 GOT Stories
body: When I see stories describing Jon and Daenerys as a “power couple” and suggesting that they can only defeat the White Walkers if “united,” I’ve got to laugh.  Did these writers actually see Season 7?  The “relationship” is Dany and Daario redux rather than anything resembling a power couple.  Jon needs Dany while Dany doesn’t need Jon and could order him executed if he defies her without any consequences.

reblog.comment: When I see stories describing Jon and Daenerys as a “power couple” and suggesting that they can only defeat the White Walkers if “united,” I’ve got to laugh.  Did these writers actually see Season 7?  The “relationship” is Dany and Daario redux rather than anything resembling a power couple.  Jon needs Dany while Dany doesn’t need Jon and could order him executed if he defies her without any consequences.

trail.content_raw: When I see stories describing Jon and Daenerys as a “power couple” and suggesting that they can only defeat the White Walkers if “united,” I’ve got to laugh.  Did these writers actually see Season 7?  The “relationship” is Dany and Daario redux rather than anything resembling a power couple.  Jon needs Dany while Dany doesn’t need Jon and could order him executed if he defies her without any consequences.
trail.content: When I see stories describing Jon and Daenerys as a “power couple” and suggesting that they can only defeat the White Walkers if “united,” I’ve got to laugh.  Did these writers actually see Season 7?  The “relationship” is Dany and Daario redux rather than anything resembling a power couple.  Jon needs Dany while Dany doesn’t need Jon and could order him executed if he defies her without any consequences.
